post.description: Creates a new event in the user's calendar.

start.title: Start
start.description: The start date and time of the event

end.title: End
end.description: The end date and time of the event

contentType.title: Contenttype
contentType.description: The content type of the event; possible values: text and html.

type.title: Type
type.description: The attendee type: required, optional, resource

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the attendee

displayName.title: Displayname
displayName.description: The display name of the location

isOnlineMeeting.title: Isonlinemeeting
isOnlineMeeting.description: Whether the event is an online meeting

type.title: Type
type.description: The recurrence pattern type: daily, weekly, absoluteMonthly, relativeMonthly, absoluteYearly, relativeYearly

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: The number of units between occurrences, where units can be in days, weeks, months, or years, depending on the type

daysOfWeek.title: Daysofweek
daysOfWeek.description: A collection of the days of the week on which the event occurs.If type is relativeMonthly or relativeYearly, and daysOfWeek specifies more than one day, the event falls on the first day that satisfies the pattern.Required if type is weekly, relativeMonthly, or relativeYearly

dayOfMonth.title: Dayofmonth
dayOfMonth.description: The day of the month on which the event occurs. Required if type is absoluteMonthly or absoluteYearly

firstDayOfWeek.title: Firstdayofweek
firstDayOfWeek.description: The first day of the week on which the event occurs.Default is sunday. Required if type is weekly

index.title: Index
index.description: Specifies on which instance of the allowed days specified in daysOfWeek the event occurs, counted from the first instance in the month. The possible values are: first, second, third, fourth, last.Default is first. Optional and used if type is relativeMonthly or relativeYearly

month.title: Month
month.description: The month in which the event occurs. This is a number from 1 to 12

type.title: Type
type.description: The recurrence range. The possible values are: endDate, noEnd, numbered.endDate -> Range with end date and requires: type, startDate, endDatenoEnd -> Range without an end date and requires: type, startDatenumbered -> Range with specific number of occurrences and requires: type, startDate, numberOfOccurrences

startDate.title: Startdate
startDate.description: The date to start applying the recurrence pattern. The first occurrence of the meeting may be this date or later, depending on the recurrence pattern of the event. Must be the same value as the start property of the recurring event.

endDate.title: Enddate
endDate.description: The date to stop applying the recurrence pattern. Depending on the recurrence pattern of the event, the last occurrence of the meeting may not be this date.Required if type is endDate.

numberOfOccurrences.title: Numberofoccurrences
numberOfOccurrences.description: The number of times to repeat the event. Required and must be positive if type is numbered.

timeZone.title: Timezone
timeZone.description: The Windows available timezone of the start and end time.Either ask for it or get the system timezone

event.title: Event
event.description: JSON representation of the Microsoft Calendar event.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description:
Calendar identifier where to add the event which can be found by listing calendars action.
Default value is using the user's default calendar.

dateTime.title: Datetime
dateTime.description: The start or end time of the event

timeZone.title: Timezone
timeZone.description: The time zone in which the time is specified

start.description: The start date and time of the event

dateTime.title: Datetime
dateTime.description: The start or end time of the event

timeZone.title: Timezone
timeZone.description: The time zone in which the time is specified

end.description: The end date and time of the event

contentType.title: Contenttype
contentType.description: The content type of the event; possible values: text and html.

type.title: Type
type.description: The attendee type: required, optional, resource

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the email owner

emailAddress.description: The email address object of the attendee

response.title: Response
response.description: The response type. Possible values are: none, organizer, tentativelyAccepted, accepted, declined, notResponded.

time.title: Time
time.description: The date and time when the response was returned

status.description: The status of the attendee's response

displayName.title: Displayname
displayName.description: The display name of the location

isOnlineMeeting.title: Isonlinemeeting
isOnlineMeeting.description: Whether the event is an online meeting

post.description: Update an existing Microsoft Calendar event.

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: Identifier of the event to update. Can be found by listing events in all calendars.

updates.title: Updates
updates.description: A dictionary containing the event attributes to update.

post.description:
List all events in the user's calendar.
To aggregate all events across calendars, call this method for each calendar returned by list_calendars endpoint.
Ideally a start and end date should always be provided, otherwise we will look in the whole future or past.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Optional OData filter parameter for customizing the query

query_params.title: Query Params
query_params.description:
JSON containing the following query parameters:
- filter -> used to filter results based on different properties; details available at: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/filter-query-parameter?tabs=http
- search -> used to search after a particular string

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description:
Calendar identifier which can be found by listing calendars action.
Default value is using the user's default calendar.

dateTime.description: The start or end time of the event

schema.title: Response for List Events
schema.description: A list of calendar events that match the query, if defined.

post.description: List all calendars that the user is subscribed to.
